title: Riemannian Metrics for Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices
text: spdmetrics implements various Riemannian metrics symmetric positive definite (SPD) matrices. provides tools computing logarithmic exponential maps, vectorization operations, statistical analyses manifold SPD matrices. package implements five different metrics: - Affine Invariant Riemannian Metric (AIRM) - Log-Euclidean - Euclidean - Log-Cholesky - Bures-Wasserstein

title: Riemannian Metrics for Symmetric Positive Definite Matrices
text: ’s basic example computing AIRM logarithm two SPD matrices: complex analyses, use CSample class:
code: library(spdmetrics) library(Matrix)  # Create two SPD matrices sigma <- Matrix(c(2.0, 0.5, 0.5, 3.0), nrow = 2) |>     nearPD() |> _$mat |> pack() lambda <- Matrix(c(1.5, 0.3, 0.3, 2.5), nrow = 2) |>     nearPD() |> _$mat |> pack()  # Compute AIRM logarithm result <- airm_log(sigma, lambda) # Create a sample of SPD matrices sample <- CSample$new(     conns = list_of_matrices,     metric_obj = airm )  # Compute Frechet mean sample$compute_fmean()  # Get sample statistics sample$variation sample$sample_cov
